title: What If Cosmic Reaver is Cannon?
body:
In the same sense that Spirit Guard Udyr is cannon meaning that this is a possible future for these character. 

http://www.bhmpics.com/thumbs/cosmic_reaver_kassadin_league_of_legends-t3.jpg

Kassadin on his quest to defeat the void came across a legend of a being who utilize the star to defeat/push back the Void. Kassadin began to look into it and was soon able to assimilate the power  either by being given by Aurelion Sol or he became an Aspect for Aurelion Sol. The latter may be being a stretch but basically is he acquire the power of the Celestial Dragon.

replies.body:
If cosmic {{champion:38}} was a cannon, he would be a very shitty cannon. 

Where the hell does he launch projectiles from?

Where is the trigger?

How the hell do I load him with blasting powder?

How the fuck do I aim him? 

http://i1-news.softpedia-static.com/images/news2/Cannon-Used-to-Fire-Drugs-over-Mexico-U-S-Border-2.jpg

Remember kids, proper grammar and spelling is the difference between:

helpin ur uncle jack off a horse
and
Helping your uncle, Jack, off a horse.

he is a great but unusual cannon,

the projectiles come the hole on the chest.

the trigger is the unarmed hand.

ammunition and gunpowder are inserted at the hole on the pelvis.

the horn like protrusions are the aiming assist, they are spread due to the spread of his attack.

he is better than a normal cannon due to a massive increase in mobility due to teleportation, and the fact that the armed hand with a blade on it will protect the cannon from being attacked from any angle while you reload.
I am appalled that you would set Kassadin under the same standard as a normal cannon he is not a simple cannon he is a space cannon A SPACE CANNON I tell you.
I think that his horns are supposed to be a very shitty gunsight.
I thought the same after reading that Aurelion is an "enemy" of the Void,

If one thinks about it,then the void is kind of like the dimensional counterpart to the outer space(I think Aurelion even speaks of aether?),I mean the void was described in cho'gaths lore as a place that connects different dimensions,while outer space is the place that connects different planets.

Aurelion Sol uniting with Kassadin giving him cosmic power to defeat the void

this would be 2 badass
Gaining the power of the true enemies of the void sounds like something he'd do.
Aurelion Sol is not an aspect.

I know he is not an aspect but being that the aspect so far are celestial by nature he could be the power source for an aspect. For example Leona aspect of the sun, diana aspect of the moon and Arteus of Pantheon. Aurelion Sol would garner his own aspect to combat them and so that aspect would be Kassadin.
